The piano cycle served as a diary of sorts of his love fo

heading: Deaths
txt: Stanley Ketchel, American boxer (b. 1886)

entities.title: Stanley Ketchel
entities.description: Stanisław Kiecal, better known in the boxing world as Stanley Ketchel, was an American professional boxer who became one of the greatest World Middleweight Champions in history. He was nicknamed "The Michigan Assassin." He was murdered at a ranch in Conway, Missouri, at the age of 24.

heading: Deaths
txt: Mata Hari, Dutch dancer and spy (b. 1876)

entities.title: Mata Hari
entities.description: Margaretha Geertruida MacLeod, better known by the stage name Mata Hari, was a Dutch exotic dancer and courtesan who was convicted of being a spy for Germany during World War I. Despite her having admitted under interrogation to taking money to work as a German spy, many people still believe she was innocent because the French Army needed a scapegoat. She was executed by firing squad in France.

heading: Deaths
txt: Sai Baba of Shirdi, Indian guru and saint (b. 1838)

entities.title: Sai Baba of Shirdi
entities.description: Sai Baba of Shirdi, also known as Shirdi Sai Baba, was an Indian spiritual master who is regarded by his devotees to be a manifestation of Sri Dattaguru and identified as a saint and a fakir. He was revered by both his Hindu and Muslim devotees during, as well as after his lifetime.

heading: Deaths
txt: Dolores Jiménez y Muro, Mexican revolutionary (b. 1848?)

entities.title: Dolores Jiménez y Muro
entities.description: Dolores Jiménez y Muro was a Mexican schoolteacher and revolutionary. A native of Aguascalientes, Aguascalientes, Mexico, she rose to prominence during the Mexican Revolution as a Socialist activist and reformer and as a supporter and associate of General Emiliano Zapata.

heading: Deaths
txt: Herbert Henry Dow, Canadian-American businessman, founded the Dow Chemical Company (b. 1866)

entities.title: Herbert Henry Dow
entities.description: Herbert Henry Dow was a Canadian-born American chemical industrialist, best known as the founder of the American multinational conglomerate Dow Chemical. He was a graduate of Case School of Applied Science in Cleveland, Ohio. He was a prolific inventor of chemical processes, compounds, and products, and was a successful businessman.

entities.title: Dow Chemical Company
entities.description: The Dow Chemical Company (TDCC) is an American multinational chemical corporation headquartered in Midland, Michigan, United States, and a subsidiary of Dow Inc. The company is among the three largest chemical producers in the world.

heading: Deaths
txt: Raymond Poincaré, French lawyer and politician, 10th President of France (b. 1860)

entities.title: Raymond Poincaré
entities.description: Raymond Nicolas Landry Poincaré was a French statesman who served three times as 58th Prime Minister of France, and as President of France from 1913 to 1920.

entities.title: President of France
entities.description: The president of France, officially the president of the French Republic, is the head of state and head of executive of France as well as the commander-in-chief of the French Armed Forces. The French presidency is the supreme magistracy of the country, and the president is the holder of the highest office in France.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lluís Companys, Catalan lawyer and politician, President of Catalonia (b. 1882)

entities.title: Lluís Companys
entities.description: Lluís Companys i Jover was a Spanish politician from Catalonia who served as president of Catalonia from 1934 and during the Spanish Civil War.

entities.title: President of Catalonia
entities.description: The president of the Government of Catalonia is one of the bodies that the Statute of Autonomy of Catalonia stipulates as part of the Generalitat de Catalunya, others being the Parliament, the government, the Consell de Garanties Estatutàries and the Síndic de Greuges. The president also serves as head of government of Catalonia, leading the executive branch of the Generalitat de Catalunya, the Ca

heading: Deaths
txt: Pierre Laval, French lawyer and politician, 101st Prime Minister of France (b. 1883)

entities.title: Pierre Laval
entities.description: Pierre Jean Marie Laval was a French politician. During the time of the Third Republic, he served as Prime Minister of France from 27 January 1931 to 20 February 1932, and a second time from 7 June 1935 to 24 January 1936.

entities.title: Prime Minister of France
entities.description: The prime minister of the French Republic, sometimes shortened to premier, is the head of government of France. During the Third and Fourth Republics, the head of government was formally called president of the Council of Ministers, generally shortened to president of the Council. However, the post was usually called "prime minister" or "premier" in non-French sources. The prime minister is the ho

heading: Deaths
txt: Hermann Göring, German general and politician (b. 1893)

entities.title: Hermann Göring
entities.description: Hermann Wilhelm Göring was a German political and military leader and a convicted war criminal. He was one of the most powerful figures in the Nazi Party, which ruled Germany from 1933 to 1945.

heading: Deaths
txt: Edythe Chapman, American actress (b. 1863)

entities.title: Edythe Chapman
entities.description: Edythe Chapman was an American stage and silent film actress.

heading: Deaths
txt: Fumio Hayasaka, Japanese composer (b. 1914)

entities.title: Fumio Hayasaka
entities.description: Fumio Hayasaka was a Japanese composer of classical music and film scores.

heading: Deaths
txt: Asaf Halet Çelebi, Turkish poet and author (b. 1907)

entities.title: Asaf Halet Çelebi
entities.description: Asaf Halet Çelebi was a Turkish mystical poet. Although not very widely known, due to his erudite and often foreign-influenced style, he is considered to be Turkey's first surrealist poet.

heading: Deaths
txt: Elizabeth Alexander, British geologist, academic, and physicist (b. 1908)

heading: Deaths
txt: Stepan Bandera, Ukrainian soldier and politician (b. 1909)

entities.title: Stepan Bandera
entities.description: Stepan Andriyovych Bandera was a Ukrainian radical politician and theorist of the militant wing of the far-right Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists and a leader and ideologist of Ukrainian ultranationalists known for his involvement in terrorist activities.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lipót Fejér, Hungarian mathematician and academic (b. 1880)

heading: Deaths
txt: Clara Kimball Young, American actress and producer (b. 1890)

entities.title: Clara Kimball Young

heading: Deaths
txt: Suryakant Tripathi 'Nirala', Indian poet and author (b. 1896)

entities.title: Suryakant Tripathi 'Nirala'
entities.description: Suryakant Tripathi, known by his pen name Nirala, was an Indian poet, novelist, essayist and story-writer. He also drew many sketches.

heading: Deaths
txt: Horton Smith, American golfer and captain (b. 1908)

entities.title: Horton Smith
entities.description: Horton Smith was an American professional golfer, best known as the winner of the first and third Masters Tournaments.

heading: Deaths
txt: Cole Porter, American composer and songwriter (b. 1891)

entities.title: Cole Porter
entities.description: Cole Albert Porter was an American composer and songwriter. Many of his songs became standards noted for their witty, urbane lyrics, and many of his scores found success on Broadway and in film.

heading: Deaths
txt: Abraham Fraenkel, German-Israeli mathematician and academic (b. 1891)

entities.title: Abraham Fraenkel
entities.description: Abraham Fraenkel was a German-born Israeli mathematician. He was an early Zionist and the first Dean of Mathematics at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem. He is known for his contributions to axiomatic set theory, especially his additions to Ernst Zermelo's axioms, which resulted in the Zermelo–Fraenkel set theory.

heading: Deaths
txt: Frederick Montague, 1st Baron Amwell, English lieutenant and politician (b. 1876)

entities.title: Frederick Montague, 1st Baron Amwell
entities.description: Frederick Montague, 1st Baron Amwell CBE was a British Labour Party politician.

heading: Deaths
txt: Virginia Lee Burton, American author and illustrator (b. 1909)

entities.title: Virginia Lee Burton
entities.description: Virginia Lee Burton, also known by her married name, Virginia Demetrios, was an American illustrator and children's book author. She wrote and illustrated seven children's books, including Mike Mulligan and His Steam Shovel (1939), and The Little House (1943), which won the Caldecott Medal. She also illustrated six books by other authors.

heading: Deaths
txt: Carlo Gambino, Italian-American mob boss (b. 1902)

entities.title: Carlo Gambino
entities.description: Carlo Gambino was an Italian-American crime boss of the Gambino crime family. After the Apalachin Meeting in 1957, and the imprisonment of Vito Genovese in 1959, Gambino took over the Commission of the American Mafia until his death from a heart attack on October 15, 1976. During more than 50 years in organized crime, he served only 22 months in prison for a tax evasion charge in 1937.

heading: Deaths
txt: W. Eugene Smith, American photojournalist (b. 1918)

entities.title: W. Eugene Smith

Later that year, he won the 1951 Scottish Grand Prix, a minor Formula One race at Winfield with this car.
